data.title: Museum of Natural History (La Paz)
data.meta_description: Museum of Natural History is a museum in La Paz. View visitor information, information about the collection and read reviews.
data.text:
The National Museum of Natural History of Bolivia, located in La Paz, was established in 1980. It was created with the aim of contributing to the scientific and cultural development of the country and to establish a center for recreation and support for formal education in the field of natural sciences and natural history.

Departments in the Museum

The museum is divided into three main departments: Zoology, Botany, and Paleontology. Each department is dedicated to the study and research of its respective field, contributing to the scientific knowledge of Bolivia's natural history.

Sections in the Museum

The museum is divided into five sections: invertebrates, fish, mammals, amphibians, reptiles, and birds. These sections showcase the diverse fauna of Bolivia, providing visitors with a comprehensive understanding of the country's wildlife.

Museum's Collection

The museum boasts a vast collection of 366,802 specimens, including both vertebrates and invertebrates. This extensive collection provides a unique opportunity for visitors to explore and learn about the diverse species found in Bolivia.
